alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mercer, central Monmouth and Middlesex Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Princeton, or 8 miles northeast of Trenton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Perth Amboy, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, Marlboro, Ewing, Princeton, Matawan, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Pennington, Princeton Meadows, Windsor, Brownville, Kingston, Dayton and Plainsboro Center. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 62 and 71. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 120 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northern New Jersey.
